title: Make build_*_amd.py faster by not using os.walk.
body_html:
When I used to run the script, it used to hang for a few seconds before
actually getting to processing files. This is because it called
os.walk, which would uselessly recursively traverse into my .git directory.
Replace this with git ls-files, which lets us ONLY edit files which
are actually in source control.

One minor downside of this patch is that you can no longer run the
HIPIFY scripts in a non-Git copy of PyTorch. I think this is not
a big deal.

Signed-off-by: Edward Z. Yang ezyang@fb.com

body:
When I used to run the script, it used to hang for a few seconds before
actually getting to processing files.  This is because it called
os.walk, which would uselessly recursively traverse into my .git directory.
Replace this with git ls-files, which lets us ONLY edit files which
are actually in source control.

One minor downside of this patch is that you can no longer run the
HIPIFY scripts in a non-Git copy of PyTorch.  I think this is not
a big deal.

Signed-off-by: Edward Z. Yang <ezyang@fb.com>
